Mass. Guard chief retires after sexual assault probe

Joseph Carter has agreed to retire after military investigators found probable cause he assaulted a subordinate in Florida in 1984. (Globe, 2:03 p.m.)
  • 4/13 Guard chief says rape charge part of 'smear'
  • 3/30 Head of Mass. National guard faces rape allegation

Romney campaign needed $20 million loan to get through Republican primary

Mitt Romney's campaign has no money shortage, but needed the loan because the bulk of its funds were earmarked for the general election. (Globe, 12:25 p.m.)

  • Many fallacies mark Romney’s depiction of the 47%

Pictures

Wakefield's 'Knuckleball!' debuts in Hub

(Photo by Erik Jacobs)
Tim Wakefield was back pitching in Boston yesterday, but instead of being on the mound, the 17-year Red Sox veteran was behind the mike talking about the new film.

UMass enrollment up to record levels

Enrollment in the system jumped more than 9,000 in five years, which school officials attribute to academic achievements and a low attendance cost. (Globe, 1:39 p.m.)

Winchester remembers former Navy SEAL

Throughout Winchester, residents lined the streets to pay respects to Glen Doherty, who died last week in an attack in Libya. (Globe, 11:40 a.m.)

SJC bars religious school teachers from bringing workplace discrimination claim

The First Amendment protects religious organizations from facing age discrimination lawsuits by teachers at religious schools, the court ruled today. (Globe, 12:24 p.m.)
